countries.name: Moldova
countries.title: Moldova Country Guide
countries.description: Tapping into Europe's most innovative IT ecosystem and high-growth talent market.

facts.mainTitle: Important Facts About the Country of Moldova

sections.title: Moldova Introduction
content: Moldova is a dynamic Eastern European nation that has rapidly transformed into a strategic tech and service hub. As an EU candidate country, it offers a unique bridge between Western and Eastern markets. With a heavy focus on digitalization and one of the most competitive tax regimes for the IT sector in the world, Moldova is a premier destination for high-efficiency global operations.

sections.title: What to Know about Moldova's Geography
content: Landlocked between Romania to the west and Ukraine to the north, east, and south, Moldova is located at a crossroads of European trade routes. The landscape is characterized by rolling hills, fertile plains, and vast vineyards. The capital, Chișinău, is the country's primary economic engine and home to a thriving international community.

sections.title: Climate in Moldova
content: Moldova enjoys a moderate continental climate with four distinct seasons. Winters are typically cold and occasionally snowy, while summers are warm and sunny—perfect for the country's world-renowned wine production. Average summer temperatures hover around 25–28°C (77–82°F).

sections.title: The Culture of Moldova
content: Moldovan culture is deeply rooted in hospitality and a strong sense of community. Known for its rich folk traditions and world-class wine heritage, the society is open, resilient, and highly adaptable. In business, Moldovans value directness, professionalism, and personal connection, often blending formal Western standards with warm local hospitality.

sections.title: Languages Spoken in Moldova
content: Romanian is the official language. However, Moldova is exceptionally multilingual: Russian is widely used in daily life and business, and English is becoming the primary language for the tech and international service sectors. Gagauz and Ukrainian are also spoken in specific regions, reflecting the country's diverse cultural fabric.

sections.title: Personal Income Tax in Moldova
content: Moldova applies a flat Personal Income Tax (PIT) rate of 12%, making it highly transparent for both residents and international employers.

sections.title: Social Security in Moldova
content: The social security and health insurance system is structured to share the responsibility between the employer and the employee.
additionalInfo: The IT Park Advantage: Companies registered in the Moldova Innovation Technology Park (MITP) benefit from a single tax of 7% on turnover, which replaces CIT, PIT, and all mandatory social and health contributions for both employer and employee.

sections.title: Public Holidays Recognized by Moldova in 2026

faqs.question: Salary Payment
faqs.answer: Salaries are paid monthly in Moldovan Leu (MDL). As of January 1, 2026, the national minimum wage has been increased to 6,300 MDL, while the average monthly salary in the economy is forecasted at 17,400 MDL.

faqs.question: Timesheets & Record Keeping
faqs.answer: The standard work week is 40 hours (typically 8 hours per day, 5 days a week). Employers must maintain accurate timesheets to manage overtime, which is compensated at a rate of 150% for the first two hours and 200% thereafter.

faqs.question: Annual Leave
faqs.answer: All employees are entitled to a minimum of 28 calendar days of paid annual leave per year, excluding public holidays.

faqs.question: Maternity & Parental Leave
faqs.answer: Female employees are entitled to 126 calendar days of paid maternity leave (70 days prenatal and 56 days postnatal). Following this, partially paid parental leave is available until the child reaches the age of 3.

faqs.question: Paternity Leave
faqs.answer: Fathers are entitled to 15 calendar days of paid paternity leave, which must be taken within the first 12 months of the child's birth. This is fully funded by the state social insurance.

faqs.question: Adoption Leave
faqs.answer: Employees who legally adopt a child are entitled to special leave benefits to facilitate the integration of the new family member, aligning with the protections provided to biological parents.

ctaSection.title: Ready to leverage Moldova’s strategic position and IT expertise?

countries.name: Armenia
countries.title: Armenia Country Guide
countries.description: Unlocking high-tech potential in the South Caucasus through a legacy of engineering and digital growth.

sections.title: Armenia Introduction
content: Armenia is a landlocked country in the South Caucasus, known for its deep historical roots and a rapidly evolving digital economy. In recent years, it has become a hotspot for tech startups and international R&D centers. With a government that prioritizes the high-tech sector and offers significant tax incentives, Armenia is a strategic choice for businesses looking for technical excellence and a competitive cost structure.

sections.title: What to Know about Armenia's Geography
content: Situated between the Black and Caspian Seas, Armenia is a mountainous country bordering Georgia, Turkey, Iran, and Azerbaijan. Its landscape is dominated by the Armenian Highlands, featuring rugged peaks, alpine lakes (including the magnificent Lake Sevan), and fertile valleys. The capital, Yerevan, is one of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities and the primary hub for the country's tech industry.

sections.title: Climate in Armenia
content: Armenia has a highland continental climate with hot, sunny summers and cold, snowy winters. Because of the varying altitudes, the weather can change significantly from one region to another. In Yerevan, summer temperatures often exceed 30°C (86°F), while winter can bring crisp air and temperatures below freezing, perfect for the nearby ski resorts.

sections.title: The Culture of Armenia
content: As the first nation to officially adopt Christianity (in 301 AD), Armenia has a rich cultural heritage reflected in its ancient monasteries and unique alphabet. It is a society that values education, music, and the arts. Armenians are known for their hospitality and a strong entrepreneurial spirit. The "Silicon Mountains" initiative reflects a culture that is moving fast towards a digital future while staying deeply connected to its ancient roots.

sections.title: Languages Spoken in Armenia
content: Armenian is the official language, written in its own beautiful script. Russian is widely spoken and understood across all generations. However, English has become the dominant second language in the tech and business sectors, with the majority of professionals in these industries being fully fluent.

sections.title: Personal Income Tax in Armenia
content: Armenia uses a simplified flat tax system. As of 2026, the Personal Income Tax (PIT) on employment income is a flat 20%.

sections.title: Social Security and Mandatory Payments
content: Armenia's payroll system is unique in that most contributions are deducted from the employee's gross salary, with the employer responsible for withholding and remitting them. Starting in 2026, a new universal health insurance system has been introduced.
additionalInfo: The IT Certificate Advantage: Tech companies that receive a government "IT Tax Certificate" benefit from a reduced 10% Personal Income Tax for their employees and a 0% Corporate Income Tax rate on their profits.

sections.title: Public Holidays Recognized by Armenia in 2026

faqs.question: Salary Payment
faqs.answer: Salaries are paid monthly in Armenian Dram (AMD). While international companies often benchmark salaries in USD to stay competitive in the tech market, all payments must be executed in the national currency through local bank transfers.

faqs.question: Timesheets & Record Keeping
faqs.answer: The standard work week is 40 hours (typically 5 days a week). Employers must maintain records of working time. Overtime is permitted but must be compensated at 1.5 times the hourly rate or with extra time off, as agreed with the employee.

faqs.question: Annual Leave
faqs.answer: Employees are entitled to a minimum of 20 working days of paid annual leave per year.

faqs.question: Maternity & Parental Leave
faqs.answer: Female employees receive 140 days of fully paid maternity leave (70 days before and 70 days after birth). This is increased to 155 days for complicated births and 180 days for multiple births.

faqs.question: Paternity Leave
faqs.answer: Fathers are entitled to 5 days of paid leave at 100% of their salary, which must be taken within the first 30 days after the child's birth.

faqs.question: Adoption Leave
faqs.answer: Employees who legally adopt a newborn child are entitled to leave starting from the day of adoption until the child reaches 70 days of age, with full social protections.

ctaSection.title: Ready to connect with the "Silicon Mountains"?
ctaSection.description: Let’s build your high-tech team in Armenia.

countries.name: Georgia
countries.title: Georgia Country Guide
countries.description: Harnessing the strategic potential of the Caucasus with Georgia's pro-business tax regimes and emerging digital talent.

sections.title: Georgia Introduction
content: Georgia is a rising star in the global business arena, consistently ranking high for ease of doing business. Located at the crossroads of Western Asia and Eastern Europe, it has become a preferred hub for international companies looking for a flexible operational environment. With special tax statuses for IT and service-oriented businesses, Georgia offers an unparalleled mix of strategic positioning and cost-efficiency.

sections.title: What to Know about Georgia's Geography
content: Nestled between the Greater Caucasus Mountains to the north and the Black Sea to the west, Georgia boasts a stunningly diverse landscape. From the high-altitude peaks of Svaneti to the subtropical coast of Batumi, the country is as geographically varied as it is strategically located. Tbilisi, the capital, is a vibrant metropolis that serves as the administrative and economic heart of the country.

sections.title: Climate in Georgia
content: Georgia's climate is highly diverse. The west experiences a humid subtropical climate, while the east is more continental with hot summers and cold winters. The Black Sea coast remains mild year-round, while the mountains offer world-class skiing in winter and cool escapes in summer.

sections.title: The Culture of Georgia
content: At the core of Georgian culture is the concept of the "Guest as a Gift from God." Hospitality is not just a habit but a way of life. Known for its ancient polyphonic singing and 8,000-year-old winemaking tradition, Georgia is a society that deeply values heritage. In business, this translates into a culture of building strong personal rapport and mutual respect before diving into formal agreements.

sections.title: Languages Spoken in Georgia
content: Georgian (Kartuli), with its own unique and ancient script, is the official language. Russian is widely understood, especially by the older generation. However, English is the primary language for the tech, business, and international sectors, with the younger workforce reaching high levels of proficiency.

sections.title: Personal Income Tax in Georgia
content: Georgia features a simple and transparent flat tax system. As of 2026, the Personal Income Tax (PIT) remains a flat 20% for all employment income.

sections.title: Social Security in Georgia
content: The social security system is primarily based on a mandatory pension contribution. There are no additional employer-paid taxes for health or unemployment insurance.
additionalInfo: The IT Benefit: Companies with "Virtual Zone Person" or "International Company" status enjoy massive tax exemptions, including 0% Corporate Income Tax on exported IT services and reduced dividend taxes (as low as 0-5%).

sections.title: Public Holidays Recognized by Georgia in 2026

rows: New Year's Day & New Year Holiday

faqs.question: Salary Payment
faqs.answer: Salaries are paid monthly in Georgian Lari (GEL). While it is common for international firms to benchmark salaries in USD or EUR to avoid currency fluctuation risks, the final payment is executed in local currency through Georgian bank transfers.

faqs.question: Timesheets & Record Keeping
faqs.answer: The standard work week is 40 hours. For specific sectors, up to 48 hours is allowed. Employers are required to maintain attendance records, and overtime must be compensated by either additional pay or extra time off, as per the Labor Code.

faqs.question: Annual Leave
faqs.answer: Employees are entitled to a minimum of 24 working days of paid annual leave per year. Additionally, they can take up to 15 days of unpaid leave if needed.

faqs.question: Maternity & Parental Leave
faqs.answer: Total leave is 730 days. Of this, 183 days are fully protected and partially paid by the state (currently capped at a one-time allowance of 1,000 GEL, though many international employers supplement this).

faqs.question: Paternity Leave
faqs.answer: Fathers are entitled to take the remaining portion of the parental leave (after the initial maternity period) to care for the child, which can be shared between parents as they see fit.

faqs.question: Adoption Leave
faqs.answer: Employees who adopt an infant under the age of 12 months are entitled to 550 days of leave from the day of birth, with 90 days being paid via a state allowance.

ctaSection.description: Let’s connect you with the talent you need.
